titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sarah R. L. Williams Letter, 1889 April 19 RL.11226
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-07-11 12:58:44 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Williams, Sarah R. L. (Sarah R. Langdon), 1822-1902

did.abstract: Collection contains a letter from Sarah R. L. Williams (1889 April 19) to Frank D. Andrews, regarding his requests for autograph letters. She mentions her "constitutional dread of bringing up the diverse memories which are inseparable from the handling of files of old letters." With envelope.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sarah R. L. Williams was a women's suffrage activist and editor of THE BALLOT BOX. She served on the executive committee of the National Woman Suffrage Association from 1873-1879.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Sarah R. L. Williams Letter was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sarah R. L. Williams Letter, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Alice L. Poffinberger, July, 2016
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0104.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains a letter from Sarah R. L. Williams (1889 April 19) to Frank D. Andrews, regarding his requests for autograph letters. She mentions her "constitutional dread of bringing up the diverse memories which are inseparable from the handling of files of old letters." With envelope.
